title: Fourth man arrested in probe of Giuliani associates
text:
New York | A Florida man wanted in a campaign finance case involving associates of Rudy Giuliani is in federal custody after flying Wednesday to Kennedy Airport in New York City to turn himself in, federal authorities said.

David Correia, 44, was named in an indictment with two Giuliani associates and another man arrested last week on charges they made illegal contributions to politicians and a political action committee supporting President Donald Trump. Mr Giuliani, a former New York City mayor, is Mr Trump's personal lawyer.

All the other defendants in the case were already in custody.

Prosecutors said Mr Correia, who owns a home with his wife in West Palm Beach, was part of efforts by co-defendants Lev Parnas and Igor Fruman to leverage outsized political donations to Republican candidates and committees as part of an effort to advance their business interests.

Both Mr Parnas and Mr Fruman have a history of business dealings with Mr Giuliani. Prosecutors said that, among other things, the pair made campaign contributions with the intent of lobbying US politicians to oust the country's ambassador to Ukraine. At the time, Mr Giuliani was trying to get Ukrainian officials to investigate the son of Mr Trump's potential Democratic challenger, Joe Biden.
description: David Correia, 44, was named in an indictment with three other men on charges they made illegal contributions to politicians and a committee supporting President Donald Trump.
